verses.verse: At the <S%H7093>end<s%> of every <S%H7651>seven<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> you shall <S%H6213>make<s%> a <S%H8059>release<s%>.

And this is the <S%H1697>manner<s%> of the <S%H8059>release<s%>: Every <S%H4874>creditor<s%> that <S%H5383>lends<s%> anything unto his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%> <S%H5065>it<s%>; he shall not exact it of his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%>, or of his <S%H251>brother<s%>; because it is <S%H7121>called<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>'s <S%H8059>release<s%>.
Of a <S%H5237>foreigner<s%> you may <S%H5065>exact<s%> it <S%H251>again<s%>: but that which is your with your brother your <S%H3027>hand<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%>;

<S%H657>However<s%> there shall be no <S%H34>poor<s%> among <S%H3068>you<s%>; for the Lord shall <S%H1288>greatly<s%> <S%H1288>bless<s%> you in the <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>gives<s%> you for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> to possess <S%H3423>it<s%>:

Only if you <S%H8085>carefully<s%> <S%H8085>listen<s%> unto the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%>, to <S%H8104>observe<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> all these <S%H4687>commandments<s%> which I <S%H6680>command<s%> you this <S%H3117>day<s%>.

For the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H1288>blesses<s%> <S%H1696>you<s%>, as he promised <S%H5670>you<s%>: and you shall lend unto <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but you shall not <S%H5670>borrow<s%>; and you shall <S%H4910>reign<s%> over <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but they shall not reign over <S%H4910>you<s%>.

If there be among you a poor <S%H34>man<s%> of <S%H259>one<s%> of your <S%H251>brothers<s%> inside <S%H259>any<s%> of your <S%H8179>gates<s%> in your <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>gives<s%> <S%H553>you<s%>, you shall not harden your <S%H3824>heart<s%>, nor <S%H7092>shut<s%> your <S%H3027>hand<s%> from your <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>:

But you shall <S%H6605>open<s%> your <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H6605>wide<s%> unto <S%H5670>him<s%>, and shall surely <S%H5670>lend<s%> him <S%H1767>sufficient<s%> for his <S%H4270>need<s%>, in that which he <S%H2637>lacks<s%>.

<S%H8104>Beware<s%> that there be not a <S%H1697>thought<s%> in your <S%H1100>wicked<s%> <S%H3824>heart<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, The <S%H7651>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%>, the <S%H8141>year<s%> of <S%H8059>release<s%>, is at <S%H7126>hand<s%>; and your <S%H5869>eye<s%> be <S%H7489>evil<s%> against your <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>, and you <S%H5414>give<s%> him <S%H7121>nothing<s%>; and he cry unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> against <S%H2399>you<s%>, and it be sin unto you.

You shall <S%H5414>surely<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H3824>him<s%>, and your heart shall not be <S%H3415>grieved<s%> when you <S%H5414>give<s%> unto <S%H1558>him<s%>: because that for this <S%H1697>thing<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> shall <S%H1288>bless<s%> you in all your <S%H4639>works<s%>, and in all that you <S%H4916>set<s%> your hand <S%H3027>unto<s%>.

For the <S%H34>poor<s%> shall never <S%H2308>cease<s%> out <S%H7130>of<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%>: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> <S%H559>you<s%>, saying, You shall <S%H6605>open<s%> your <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H6605>wide<s%> unto your <S%H251>brother<s%>, to your <S%H6041>poor<s%>, and to your <S%H34>needy<s%>, in your <S%H776>land<s%>.

And if your <S%H251>brother<s%>, an Hebrew <S%H5680>man<s%>, or an Hebrew <S%H5680>woman<s%>, be <S%H4376>sold<s%> unto <S%H5647>you<s%>, and serve you <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>; then in the <S%H7637>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> you shall let him <S%H7971>go<s%> free from <S%H2670>you<s%>.
And when you <S%H7971>send<s%> him out <S%H2670>free<s%> from <S%H7971>you<s%>, you shall not let him go away <S%H7387>empty<s%>:

You shall <S%H6059>furnish<s%> him <S%H6059>liberally<s%> out of your <S%H6629>flock<s%>, and out of your <S%H1637>floor<s%>, and out of your <S%H3342>winepress<s%>: of that with which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> has <S%H1288>blessed<s%> you you shall give unto <S%H5414>him<s%>.

And you shall <S%H2142>remember<s%> that you were a <S%H5650>bondman<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, and the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> <S%H6680>you<s%>: therefore I command you this <S%H1697>thing<s%> to <S%H3117>day<s%>.
And it shall <S%H559>be<s%>, if he say unto <S%H3318>you<s%>, I will not go away from <S%H157>you<s%>; because he loves you and your <S%H1004>house<s%>, because he is well with <S%H2895>you<s%>;

Then you shall <S%H3947>take<s%> an <S%H4836>awl<s%>, and <S%H5414>thrust<s%> it through his <S%H241>ear<s%> unto the <S%H1817>door<s%>, and he shall be your <S%H5650>servant<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>. And also unto your <S%H519>maidservant<s%> you shall do <S%H6213>likewise<s%>.

It shall not seem <S%H7185>hard<s%> unto <S%H5869>you<s%>, when you send him <S%H7971>away<s%> <S%H2670>free<s%> from <S%H7939>you<s%>; for he has been worth a <S%H4932>double<s%> hired <S%H7916>servant<s%> to <S%H5647>you<s%>, in serving you <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>: and the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> shall <S%H1288>bless<s%> you in all that you <S%H6213>do<s%>.

All the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> <S%H2145>males<s%> that <S%H3205>come<s%> of your <S%H1241>herd<s%> and of your <S%H6629>flock<s%> you shall <S%H6942>sanctify<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%>: you shall do no <S%H5647>work<s%> with the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> of your <S%H7794>bullock<s%>, nor <S%H1494>shear<s%> the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> of your <S%H6629>sheep<s%>.

You shall <S%H398>eat<s%> it <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> by <S%H8141>year<s%> in the <S%H4725>place<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> shall <S%H977>choose<s%>, you and your <S%H1004>household<s%>.

And if there be any <S%H3971>blemish<s%> in <S%H6455>it<s%>, as if it be lame, or <S%H5787>blind<s%>, or have any <S%H7451>ill<s%> <S%H3971>blemish<s%>, you shall not <S%H2076>sacrifice<s%> it unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> your <S%H430>God<s%>.

You shall <S%H398>eat<s%> it inside your <S%H8179>gates<s%>: the <S%H2931>unclean<s%> and the <S%H2889>clean<s%> person shall eat it <S%H3162>alike<s%>, as the <S%H6643>roebuck<s%>, and as the <S%H354>hart<s%>.
Only you shall not <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H1818>blood<s%> <S%H8210>there<s%>; you shall pour it upon the <S%H776>ground<s%> as <S%H4325>water<s%>.
